channel.title: Msbuild on Sad Robot
channel.description: Recent content in Msbuild on Sad Robot

item.title: Debugging MSBuild scripts
item.description: If you want to debug an MSBuild script from without Visual Studio, you need to use the /debug command line option. The trick is that this option is not normally available; you need to set a registry key to enable it. Enable the MSBuild Debugger Under the HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMSBuild4.0 key, create a string value called EnableDebugger with a value of “true”. If you’re on a 64 bit system, you’ll also want to set the same value under the key HKLMSoftwareWow6432NodeMicrosoftMSBuild4.
